title: Calendar
description: Use the calendar component to create custom date pickers

body.raw:
## Static Prop

Set `static` to make the date picker static and not select dates on click.

<CalendarIndicatorDemo />

## Custom date pickers

Use the `Calenedar` component along with the `getDayProps` function to build your own custom date pickers.

<WeekPickerDemo />

## Hiding outside dates

Use the `hideOutsideDates` prop to hide dates outside the current month.

<CalendarHideOutsideDatesDemo />

## Overriding styles

Use the `classNames` prop to pass custom class names to the calendar. The following example makes all weekends purple

<PurpleWeekendCalendar />

title: Date Picker
description: Use the date picker component to create date pickers that match your design.

body.raw:
<DatePickerDemo />

## Alternative selection modes

### Range

Set the prop `mode` to `range` to enable the range selection mode.

<DateRangeDemo />

### Multiple

Set the prop `mode` to `multiple` to enable the multiple selection mode.

<DatePickerMultipleDemo />

## Controlled state

The following example uses a state value to keep track of the date range and renders it in a popover.

<DateRangeInPopoverDemo />

## Number of columns

The date picker can be configured to show a different number of columns. Using the `numberOfColumns` prop. The following example shows a date picker with 2 columns.

<DatePickerTwoColumnDemo />

## Min and max dates

You can set the minimum and maximum dates that can be selected using the `minDate` and `maxDate` props.

<MinMaxDateDemo />

## The size prop

The `size` prop can be used to change the size of the date picker. Sizes xs, sm, md, lg, and xl are available.

<DatePickerWithSizeDemo />

## Change the month and year item formats

Using the `monthsListFormat` and `yearsListFormat` props, you can change the format of the month and year items.
Refer to the [dayjs documentation](https://day.js.org/docs/en/display/format) for more information on the formatting options.

<MonthYearFormatDemo />

## Using the date picker inside a `@shadcn/ui` form

The date picker can be used inside a `@shadcn/ui` form. The following example shows a date picker inside a form.

<DatePickerInFormDemo />

## Selecting a single date in a range

By default clicking a date twice will deselect it. If you want to allow your users to select a single date use the `allowSingleDateInRange` prop.

<DatePickerSingleDateInRangeDemo />

## Localization

The date picker can be localized by passing a locale string to the `locale` prop. The following example shows a date picker with a custom locale.

### Locale prop

Use the `locale` prop to set the locale of the date picker.

<DatePickerLocaleDemo />

### First day of week prop

Use the `firstDayOfWeek` prop to set the first day of the week.

<DatePickerLocaleWeekdayStartDemo />

title: Getting Started
description: How to install and use the calendar

body.raw:
## Initializing `@shadcn/ui`

Before you can use the calendar component, you need to initialize the `@shadcn/ui` package.
This will add the necessary CSS to your project.

<InitializeShadCnCode />

## Installing `@you-got-bud/calendar`

Install the calendar compoent with the package manager of your choice.

<InstallCalendarCode />

## Setting up tailwindcss

We need to tell tailwindcss to include the calendar styles in the build.

<TailwindContent />

## Using the Date Picker

Now you can use the date-picker/calendar in your project refer to the [calendar](/docs/calendar) and [date-picker](/docs/date-picker) for more information.
